sections.heading: Creation - Commissioner - Organization - PersonnelSection 25-7-102 - Center for Workforce ExcellenceSection 25-7-103 - Emergency grants - Extra help pool
sections.text:
(a)There is created a Division of Higher Education.(b)(1)The executive head of the Division of Higher Education shall be the Commissioner of the Division of Higher Education.(2)The commissioner shall be appointed by the Governor and shall serve at the pleasure of the Governor.(3)The commissioner shall report to the Secretary of the Department of Education.(c)The Division of Higher Education shall consist of the Arkansas Higher Education Coordinating Board and any other divisions that may be created by law and placed under the Division of Higher Education.(d)(1)The commissioner, with the advice and consent of the Governor, and the Secretary of the Department of Education, shall appoint the heads of the respective divisions.(2)(A)All of the personnel of the Division of Higher Education shall be employed by and serve at the pleasure of the commissioner.(B)However, nothing in this section shall be construed as reducing any right that an employee shall have under any civil service or merit system.(e)(1)Each division of the Division of Higher Education shall be under the direction, control, and supervision of the commissioner.(2)The commissioner may delegate his or her functions, powers, and duties to various divisions of the Division of Higher Education as he or she deems desirable or necessary for the effective and efficient operation of the Division of Higher Education.(f)The institutions of higher education in this state shall cooperate with the Division of Higher Education in an effort to coordinate their programs.Amended by Act 2023, No. 786,§ 54, eff. 4/12/2023.Amended by Act 2019, No. 910,§ 2384, eff. 7/1/2019.Amended by Act 2017, No. 866,§ 1, eff. 8/1/2017.Acts 1971, No. 38, § 9; A.S.A. 1947, § 5-909; Acts 1997, No. 1114, § 14.

sections.heading: Center for Workforce Excellence
sections.text:
(a)For the purpose of this section, "center" means the Center for Workforce Excellence.(b)(1)There is created the Center for Workforce Excellence which shall conduct a pilot project to assist industrial development through the coordination of training programs and services.(2)The pilot project shall be a cooperative effort among Ouachita Technical College, Malvern High School, the Grande Nutrino Project Consortium, private industry, and other appropriate groups.(3)Local industrial groups, local governmental units, and private enterprise should provide much of the financial support needed for the pilot project. Such support should include financial support for items such as office space, expenses, and utilities.(4)The Ouachita Technical College Board shall establish guidelines governing the operation of the center.(c)(1)The goals of the center shall be to:(A)Facilitate the development of students and workers, members of the "learning force" within Arkansas communities and companies, with a focus on workers' skills and workplace tools of the future, particularly high-level technical training and education; and(B)Foster skills, knowledge, and understanding relevant to real-world jobs, careers, and lifestyles through the economic competitiveness of students, workers, communities, companies, and associated groups in a global political community.(2)The center shall develop a strategic management plan to include initial industry services training, with a survey of existing facilities, opportunities for training within the potential project area, and development of a campaign plan to overcome training deficiencies in the areas through reliance on existing resources through the cooperation and development of new training capability through innovative low cost means.(3)The center shall assist private industry in determining what training services and programs are available, the steps necessary to provide the training services and programs needed by the industry, and how long it would take to develop the needed training services and programs.(d)(1)The Ouachita Technical College Board shall establish a local advisory committee to provide guidance to the center in implementing the pilot project. The local advisory committee shall include representatives of Ouachita Technical College, Malvern High School, the Grande Nutrino Project Consortium, and private industry. The board may include representatives of other appropriate groups and organizations.(2)The purpose of the local advisory committee shall be to assist the center in determining the proper focus for industrial development.(3)The local advisory committee shall make recommendations concerning:(A)"Soft skills", interpersonal relationships such as discipline, self-reliance, and an ability to communicate properly;(B)"Hard skills", such as skills required of workers by technical training;(C)Apprenticeship and internship programs for students and potential workers; and(D)Other issues concerning the training and development of students and workers.Acts 1992 (1st Ex. Sess.), No. 52, §§ 1-6; 1993, No. 665, § 1.

sections.heading: Emergency grants - Extra help pool
sections.text:
(a)An institution of higher education affected by a disaster emergency resulting in the interruption of all or a significant portion of campus operations may request disaster assistance through the Division of Higher Education.(b)Upon the declaration of a disaster emergency by the Governor under §12-75-107, an institution of higher education affected by the disaster emergency may request, subject to the recommendation of the Commissioner of the Division of Higher Education and approval by the Governor, a grant from the Disaster Relief Fund to:(1)Return the institution of higher education to normal operations; or(2)(A)Enable a campus that is part of and incorporated into the institution of higher education affected by the disaster emergency to provide services to the students enrolled in the campus of the institution of higher education affected by the disaster emergency.(B)A certified law enforcement officer employed by an institution of higher education during the declaration of a disaster emergency by the Governor under §12-75-107may be granted jurisdiction at a campus that is part of and incorporated into the institution of higher education affected by the disaster emergency upon agreement of both campuses.(c)(1)The division is authorized a pool of five hundred (500) extra help positions for use in an emergency or a disaster event.(2)The extra help positions authorized under subdivision (c)(1) of this section may be assigned to:(A)The campus affected by the disaster emergency; or(B)A campus that is part of and incorporated into the institution of higher education affected by the disaster emergency that is providing services to the students enrolled in the campus affected by the disaster emergency.(3)The Governor may waive the restriction on periods of time during which an employee may be employed as extra help during a fiscal year under §6-63-314.Added by Act 2023, No. 870,§ 30, eff. 7/1/2023.
